content.description:
From the base of

Moan, eh?

, scramble up and right about 20 feet to a platform. Directly above the platform is a left-facing corner, the line of

Klimb It

. This platform is up and left from the start of

Go Gane

.

Go up the left-facing corner about eight feet to a ledge. Step left about six feet and climb the featured face to the top.
content.protection: In order to TR the route, you'll need large cams (blue and grey Camalots) and an anchor rope.
content.location:
From the base of

Moan, eh?

, scramble up and right about 20 feet to a platform. Directly above the platform is a left-facing corner, the line of

Klimb It

. This platform is up and left from the start of

Go Gane

.

content.description:
Start just right of

The Matisse Falcon

at the next groove, which leads up to a black bulge and a horizontal crack.

Climb the groove to the horizontal crack. Move up and right in the crack past the black bulge, then go up and left along a flake/crack until you can slab climb to the top.
content.protection: Carry gear to a blue Camalot and some long slings.
content.location:
Start just right of

The Matisse Falcon

at the next groove, which leads up to a black bulge and a horizontal crack.

content.description: This route starts with a crux thin face, and then finishes with a weird steep lieback (5.9)
content.protection: One bolt (3/8"), a few pieces of gear (up to 3 inches) for the upper crack.

content.description:
Start about 20 feet right of

Woman with a Parasol

at a right-leaning ramp. This ramp is near the right end of the south face of Dinosaur Rock.

Climb up the ramp then easily go back up and left on a slab to an obvious crack in a bulge. Pull the bulge at the crack (likely harder if you are short) and follow the crack to the top.
content.protection: Carry gear to at least a blue Camalot.
content.location:
Start about 20 feet right of

Woman with a Parasol

at a right-leaning ramp. This ramp is near the right end of the south face of Dinosaur Rock.

content.description:
Negasaurus

starts in a short layback crack which leads to a ledge. It is right next to a small tree that short people can use as a starter hold. A height dependant move into the crack above the ledge leads to the right shoulder of the formation. From there hand traverse left out to a thin hands splitter crack with face holds to the top.
content.protection: You need a small standard rack, a couple mid size cams and stoppers

content.description: Start on the left (west) portion of the southwest face of Dinosaur Rock in an alcove below an obvious crack system. The is directly across the small valley from the Hobbit Hole boulder. Scramble about 25 feet up the boulders until you are under a bombay crack. Squirm up into the off-width crack, then follow it more easily to the top.
content.protection: Carry gear to a purple Camalot. Finger sized gear is needed for the anchor. If you wish to set up a TR, you'll need an anchor rope.
content.location: Start on the left (west) portion of the southwest face of Dinosaur Rock in an alcove below an obvious crack system. The is directly across the small valley from the Hobbit Hole boulder. Scramble about 25 feet up the boulders until you are under a bombay crack.

content.description:
Start at the next crack system to the left of

The Soar Us

. The crack diagonals slightly to the left and is just right of some boulders. The crack is roughly 20 feet left of the start of

Dyno-soar

.

Climb the slightly left-leaning, gritty crack system past a bulge to the top.
content.protection: Carry gear to a grey Camalot.
content.location:
Start at the next crack system to the left of

The Soar Us

. The crack diagonals slightly to the left and is just right of some boulders. The crack is roughly 20 feet left of the start of

Dyno-soar

.

content.description:
Start about 30 feet right of

Too Loose to Trek

in a small alcove below a groove/chimney.

Climb up into a groove and struggle up this to a stance. Follow the slightly right-curving chimney to the top. There is a pine tree at the top of this climb.
content.protection: Carry gear to a purple Camalot, with a green and red needed for the crux groove down low.
content.location:
Start about 30 feet right of

Too Loose to Trek

in a small alcove below a groove/chimney.

content.description:
Scramble up and right about 20 feet from the base of

Moan Eh?

to a platform. Above the platform is an obvious left-facing corner. Down and right from the platform is the start of

Go Gane

.

Climb the left-facing corner, passing a bulge down low. About mid-height, transition left into the vertical crack, which is followed to the top.
content.protection: Carry gear to a purple Camalot. Blue and grey Camalots are needed  for the anchor. If you wish to TR the route, you'll need an anchor rope.
content.location:
Scramble up and right about 20 feet from the base of

Moan Eh?

to a platform. Above the platform is an obvious left-facing corner. Down and right from the platform is the start of

Go Gane

.

content.description:
Start about twenty feet to the right of Too Loose to Trek.

Climb the easy slab to a horizontal crack/small roof, then up a shallow left-facing corner and seam to the top.
content.protection: An anchor rope is needed to set this up as a TR.
content.location: Start about eight feet to the right of Too Loose to Trek in roughly the middle of the south face of Dinosaur Rock.

content.description: start to the left of Gorgasaurus on the left trending hand crack. follow up to a small ledge to gain a good rest. start into the next left trending hand crack to pull the crux (mental) move (a small mantle) to a decent stance. work your way over into the next larger crack on a small traverse to gain a nice crack to the top. Great boulder on top for a bomber anchor set up. down climb to get off through a small cave to the left of the anchor or find the rap bolts on top somewhere
content.location: back side of Dinosaur rock, shade all day to the left of gorgasaurus' indirect start. Just in front of the nice tree. three left trending cracks

content.description: This route crosses the north face of Dinosaur Rock on the obvious diagonal crack. It starts just around the corner to the left in a crack that doesn't quite reach the ground.

climbs.name: Goolabunga
climbs.fa: D. Evans, J. Angione, C. Bransford and T. Gordon 5/89

content.description: Goolabunga starts with the entry move on Negasaurus. From the right end of the ledge above you can reach the arete of the little dihedral that is to the right of the route. Pinch the arete and head on up. There are several 5.10 moves but they are all well protected by the bolts.
content.protection: 4 bolts and several mid sized cams (2-3") to protect up to the bolts.

content.description:
Start at the base of the cliff roughly 40 feet to the right of

Moan eh?

and 15 feet to the left of

Too Loose to Trek

.

Climb up lower-angled rock to reach an overhanging band of rock with two parallel, vertical cracks (the right one has a bush in it). Pull the overhang using the left crack, then move slightly right to gain an obvious chimney, which is followed to the top.
content.protection: Carry gear to a purple Camalot and some long slings.
content.location:
Start at the base of the cliff roughly 40 feet to the right of

Moan eh?

and 15 feet to the left of

Too Loose to Trek

.

climbs.name: Dyno-soar
climbs.fa: Todd Swain & Peggy Buckey 04-1986  FFA: Kris Solem 01-1992

content.description:
Start near the left edge of the northwest face below a vertical seam. Climb up and right along seams to reach two bolts

(note as of 12-2020, these are still the original 1/4" bolts from the FA in 1986!!!

). Climb past two bolts (crux past 2nd bolt) to reach the right-trending crack of

Gorgasaurus.

Step right, then follow a thin crack up and left to another horizontal. Move right to finish up the final crack on

Negasaurus

.
content.location:
Start between

Gorgasaurus

and

Negasaurus

, near the left edge of the northwest face below a vertical seam.
